flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=52>>52 photos.
When Tim has 52 photos, then Paul has 52 + 10 photos = <<52+10=66>>66 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 52 photos + 66 photos = <<52+66=118>>118 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 118 photos = <<152-118=34>>34 photos.
#### 34

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 62, not 66. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
